summary: This is an email exchange between US Attorney's Office personnel discussing attorney Jordan Merson's potential lawsuit filings related to Jeffrey Epstein. The email expresses skepticism about Merson's claims and notes the office is unaware of any actual filings or specific victims he represents.

persons.context: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York, inquiring about new allegations in filings by attorney Jordan Merson.

persons.name: Jordan Merson

events.title: Berman inquiry about Merson filings
events.description: Geoffrey Berman emails asking if there are any new allegations of abuse as minors in filings by attorney Jordan Merson this week.

events.title: Response regarding Merson's claims
events.description: Response email indicates the team is skeptical of Jordan Merson's claims, noting no actual lawsuit filings are known, no engagement with him, and no knowledge of specific victims he represents.

keyFacts: Attorney Jordan Merson claimed on his website to have filed more lawsuits against Jeffrey Epstein than any other New York lawyer.
The US Attorney's Office team expressed skepticism about Merson's claims, stating they were unaware of any actual lawsuits filed by him.
The team noted Merson had never engaged with their office or reached out, and they were unaware of any specific Epstein victims he represented.
The email exchange shows the US Attorney's Office monitoring legal filings and allegations related to the Epstein case in December 2019.
